You don't owe any taxes and Govt has to give you money...

replies.msg:
Your 2018 income was too low and pay no taxes. All taxes you paid will be refunded to you if you were in Alberta for the full year inn 2018.. Personal exemption deduction are based on how long you stayed in Alberta within a calendar year.

You MAY owe some money in 2019 but I don't think you end up paying any. There are other deductions that I didn't include and you may be entitled to. Also, there are GST credit etc. that I didn't calculate and you may end up paying nothing for 2019 either.

The bottom line is you may get at least $3,000 from Govt...
Hope you can sleep tonight..

replies.msg:
You should go to the University website and get the Form T2202
Tuition you paid to University and education amount for all years.
2018, 2017, 2016 and 2015....There should be a Form t2202 for each calendar year

These tuition can carry forward to the years you have to pay taxes.
You should be able to download it from University website after you sign
in using your sign in information.

You may be able to deduct ( credit) your tuition fees from your 2019 income tax.

this is the site for U of Calgary. You should be able to find the same from your University/college

https://conted.ucalgary.ca/info/incometax_receipts.jsp

your accountant fees just went up--- $150 to $200 a year?

replies.msg:
You can register an account with CRA and input your bank inforamtion.
They will refund the money directly to your bank account after they assess (check) your income tax returns (T1). It should tax a few days to a few weeks.

set up an account with CRA
https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/e-services/cra-login-services/cra-user-password-help-faqs/registration-process-access-cra-login-services.html#hlp1a

set up direct deposit with CRA-
https://www.canada.ca/en/revenue-agency/services/about-canada-revenue-agency-cra/direct-deposit.html

我頭先仲係咁諗penalty
//You paid $2933 taxes... //
所以$2933 will be fully returned back?

Thank you

Your 2018 income was too low and pay no taxes. All taxes you paid will be refunded to you if you were in Alberta for the full year inn 2018.. Personal exemption deduction are based on how long you stayed in Alberta within a calendar year.

You MAY owe some money in 2019 but I don't think you end up paying any. There are other deductions that I didn't include and you may be entitled to. Also, there are GST credit etc. that I didn't calculate and you may end up paying nothing for 2019 either.

The bottom line is you may get at least $3,000 from Govt...
Hope you can sleep tonight..

your accountant fees just went up--- $150 to $200 a year?

replies.msg:
You can refile up to 10 years back tax returns and you should get some money back - GST tax credit etc. Ask your accountant.. You fees just went up again. File a return even if you don't have any income because you will not get any tax credits if you don't file. These returns with no taxes paid should be under $50 each year..

Remember to get all your T2202 forms (Tuition)and all previous rent paid (ask your accountant if you need them) The tuition you paid can be use in 2019 (first year you pay any taxes) and subsequent years...
You should consider buying RRSP if you have money left, that could reduce your income taxes payable or open a TFSA account ( Tax Free Savings Account).

replies.msg:
You can consider doing 2017, 2016, 2015, 2014, 2013, 2012, 2010, 2009 tax returns by yourself. Just fill out the forms and no income to report and file it. Your accountant may charge you $50 each returns that basically just filling out your address, SIN number etc.

https://turbotax.community.intuit.ca/community/troubleshooting/discussion/how-far-back-how-many-years-can-you-claim-for-gst-hst-credit-not-received-due-to-not-filling-tax/00/897274

replies.msg: You have to be over 19 years old to qualify for GST credit. If you are under 19 in any of the previous years, you may not qualify for those years.
